utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so over this past five days I've had um worsening shortness of breath and uh some discomfort in my chest um and this cough that that's been getting worse as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it's just been for the past uh past week or five days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I mean I've had um a cough and uh in the in the in the past, and and and shortness of breath in the past. But yeah, just over these past five days it's been there um at all, like it's been there all day and it's been getting uh worse as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what is the cough like? Is it wet or dry?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'm bringing up sputum uh pretty much um like every time I'm coughing up I'm bringing up some yellowish or greenish uh sputum.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you noticed at all any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, no blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No blood, OK, um and how much sputum are you bringing up like uh every time you cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I would say its um would would be the like just the little inside of my uh palm each time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh is this uh, and then what about the shortness of breath, is it uh are you having trouble taking deep breaths or do you find yourself breathing faster? Like how would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's um yeah, I'm just really feeling like I just can't, uh catch my breath even with um some small things around the apartment uh that normally I can do, it's any type of exertion, I just can't catch my breath. I'm OK right now just sitting here though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, so at rest you're fine but like when you exert yourself, it gets worse.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, well I'm I still have this like uh chest discomfort. Um so while while sitting here, it doesn't feel um like my breathing is normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when do you get that chest discomfort? Is it when you're breathing in or breathing out or it, can it be just due to exercise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's it's kind of just always, it's just kind of been there over these past uh like four or five days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how would you describe uh, is it pain at all or is it like sharp stabbing or pressure like pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, nothing like that. I kind of I just I feel congested I guess.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um so just discomfort. Do you do your symptoms get worse at all when you're laying down flat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Uh, do you wake up at night gasping, gasping for air?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't done that before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um have you had any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, uh now that you mentioned, I do think I I feel a bit feverish. Um uh yeah, and I I've noticed that actually over the last uh couple of days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, have you had a chance to take your temperature at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I just felt feverish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um do you have any other symptoms like um sore throat, runny nose, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um have you traveled at all recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I I I I've been been home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you tried anything to help you with your symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I I did try uh, using an inhaler. I have um a couple up those and um usually that that helps, but hasn't really been able to um help much this time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um how often are you having to use it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um so uh I I used it um I I took three or four puffs this morning and um and that was about it. I was using it last night as well, uh but typically I will use it maybe two or three times a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and have you had any headaches or changes in your vision or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um any increased fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I, I mean, I haven't been able to do as much with uh being so short of breath, but my energy has been been OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about um, do you have any sensation of palpitations or your heart is racing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't felt anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and any kind of diarrhea or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any issues with urination?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, uh no problems there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh any changes in your sleep or appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, that that's been pretty good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I haven't had any night sweats.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um any kind of uh significant weight change recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I I I might have, uh no, I think my weight's been about the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um any exposure to anyone sick around you recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so. Um but I I've had I've had a couple of uh chest colds over the last year that I needed um antibiotics for uh and it, they they went away after that, I got that, those from a walk in clinic.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sorry, you got antibiotics from the walk in clinic?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, the last time was uh probably about about four months ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I haven't been around anybody sick recently, but um but I mean I I've had similar symptoms um before, I feel like this time might be just a bit worse though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and do you have any past medical history? Uh any conditions you've been diagnosed with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah, so I I have been I've been diagnosed with COPD uh as well as uh, high blood pressure and uh GERD.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when were you diagnosed with COPD?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh about three years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Three years ago, OK. Do you take any medications for any of these conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I have a medication uh Ventolin, I take Symbicort daily um which is like a steroid type medication. And then um I take an ACE inhibitor I think for blood pressure and just Tums or something like that if my reflux is bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and do you have any allergies to any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Any past hospitalizations or surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any family history of any medical conditions, any lung or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh nothing like that, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and any cancers in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and any, currently right now, what's your living situation like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so um I'm living with um with just my uh daughter in a in an apartment.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and currently do you work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I I've been working at the um at the grocery store. Uh yeah, I've been at the grocery store.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you smoke currently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do, yeah. Uh I smoke about a pack a day. Um and I I've smoked for, now well, probably like 30 or 40 years. I used to smoke more.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um you have cut down, that's good. Um yeah, definitely the more you cut down, and if you need to talk about quitting, there's a lot of resources that we can go through. Um do you use anything else besides uh cigarettes, like any marijuana or any other drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, no, just just cigarettes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and any alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I mean I'll have some uh wine with dinner on the weekends, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, so those are all the questions I had for you. Do you have any questions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that was, uh, about it I was uh I was wondering if you think I I have an infection or is this uh COPD acting up, or what's going on?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so definitely with your history of COPD and um these symptoms, it can just be an exacerbation of your COPD and that can happen sometimes when you have COPD and then you get a either viral or bacterial infection and that makes your symptoms worse, and you've also had a fever, so we'll do like a full physical examination, get your vitals, everything, but uh and then we'll give you some uh like nebulized like um for your home puffers too, but all just in the hospital and monitor your response to them. Uh and then we'll also get like your, some of your blood work and chest X-ray just to see if there's any like pneumonia. And lastly we'll just get like a Covid swab done since some of these symptoms also overlap with Covid symptoms. Um and yeah so we'll, so that's what we'll do um and I'll let the emergency department know that you're on your way. I think you'll need to get all those tests there, and then they'll decide whether or not you need any kind of admission or you can just go home on antibiotics um from there, OK?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, that sounds good. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah yeah alright take care.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
